intro: Leucosyke samarensis, commonly known as the Samarensis milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in this family. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals, and it produces蓇葖 fruits that contain seeds with silky hairs. Leucosyke samarensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
